objectives: Use CL:3, CL:1, and CL:B to show vehicles, people, and surfaces

vocab.def: Vehicle classifier; shows movement of a car, bus, bike.
Person classifier; shows walking path or standing position.
Fixed locus in space for a landmark.
Path movement from start to finish using classifiers.
Take perspective of giver or follower of directions.

sections.heading: Warm-Up: Anchor 3 Landmarks

media.caption: Anchor SCHOOL left, STORE right, HOME center

sections.body: Pick 3 anchors in front of you. Label: **SCHOOL, STORE, HOME.** Reuse these consistently.

options: Reuse the same space for the same landmark

sections.heading: Model: CL Paths
sections.body: Example: **CL:3** drives from SCHOOL ‚Üí STORE. Add **CL:1** walking path crossing. Use **CL:B** flat hand for road layout.

microCheck.q: Which classifier shows a car or bus?

sections.heading: Role-Shift Directions
sections.body: Practice RS: **RS‚ÜíGiver:** **FROM HOME DRIVE STRAIGHT, LEFT SCHOOL.** (neutral) **RS‚ÜíFollower:** **OK.** Keep clauses 3‚Äì5 signs.

callouts.title: Return to Neutral
callouts.body: Always reset between RS lines to avoid confusion.

options: Return to neutral between RS lines

sections.heading: Partner Drill: Map Exchange
sections.body: 1) Anchor 3 landmarks. 2) Partner A gives directions (RS Giver). 3) Partner B repeats path (RS Follower). Swap roles.

callouts.title: Anchor Drift
callouts.body: Re-point if SCHOOL or STORE shifts location over time.

sections.heading: Mini-Showcase
sections.body: Record a **15‚Äì20s** clip giving directions from HOME to STORE with at least **2 landmarks**, **1 CL:3 path**, and **1 RS exchange**.
sections.teacherNote: Caption should name the landmarks anchored and which classifiers were used.
